WRITING.TITLE: I fucking regret harming to the point of nerve damage
WRITING.TEXT: Long story FYI and fuckton of swearing lol Basically my biggest regret is getting serious fucking nerve damage. It was a c#t on the inside of my wrist about 1/4 of the way up my forearm. The second I did it there was this lightning bolt feeling that shot from the c#t all the way up my wrist, through my hand and up my finger tips. I instantly went oh shit I have absolutely fucked up this time. Went to emergency as usual to get stitches, and as per normal they do the whole #8220;bend your arm, bend your hand, put pressure against me, can you feel everything when I touch here etc #8221; and I basically sitting there shitting myself and went #8220;I can #8217;t feel half my hand #8221;. The triage nurse kinda sighed and basically said the feeling won #8217;t come back. I hit the median nerve and I #8217;m SO fucking LUCKY it affected the back of my hand not the inside of my hand. Part of me didn #8217;t even compute what the nurse said. I was so shitty with myself for letting it happen. It #8217;s hard to explain it #8217;s feeling. It #8217;s both numb and constant pins and needles. I can #8217;t feel temperature with it and have accidentally burnt myself with hot water because I didn #8217;t realise it was too hot. It fucking KILLS when there #8217;s pressure anywhere from where the c#t and wrist to the back of my hand. Anything from a light touch to a firm push is agony in certain spots. Honestly I #8217;m still in disbelief I #8217;ve lived with this for like 5 years now. It #8217;s just...there. I can touch my finger tips on the outside under the nail and feel this tingling in my wrist, and I can touch my wrist and feel a tingle in my fingers. It #8217;s fucking weird. I hate that my hand will always be like this. Most fucked up part is even after I did this c#t I kept c#tting lmao but never in that spot on my arm again either left or right arm. Too fucking risky because I #8217;ve done irreversible damage now and don #8217;t want more serious nerve damage (I #8217;ve got lots of random spots of nerve damage on my arms but my hand is the worst shit). TL;DR nerve damage fucking sucks and my hand is just gunna be fucked forever over a single c#t I made 5 years ago rip Sorry edit because I forgot how italics works here - EDIT: Holy crap this rant got a lot more attention than I expected. Can I just say thank you for the kind words, this hasn #8217;t been easy for me to deal with at all. I #8217;m a year clean now from harming. I also want to raise this though. THIS WASN #8217;T EVEN THAT DEEP OF A C*T. You might think I #8217;m just saying that, but trust me, my arms have had much deeper wounds, and this was kind of at the #8220;start #8221; of me harming (I #8217;d only been harming a year and a bit and then harmed another 4 years after that sadly). You are literally DANCING AROUND IMPORTANT NERVES every time you do this, especially on your arms. I #8217;m being incredibly serious right now. Nerve damage is no joke, and I think the SH community doesn #8217;t have enough visibility on this. I wasn #8217;t just left with a scar this time. I was left with lifelong nerve damage.

Thank you, I really don #8217;t wish this upon anyone else. I had the same mindset of #8220;it #8217;s not like anything bad will happen to me #8221; and thinking all that comes out of self harming is scars. I #8217;m a year clean now and have just started uni after never finishing school :)
You really are risking permanent damage every time you do this. Not everyone just comes out with scars. Thank you kindly
It #8217;s a very strange feeling isn #8217;t it? I just hate the sensitivity my hand has to pressure.

It #8217;s always such a risk and you *know* it #8217;s not good and can still want to do it and it #8217;s this constant mental battle. Trust me though, it just takes one wrong move in the wrong spot.

It is a very odd feeling. The worst part for me is how bad pressure on certain areas are and I need to be careful to avoid the sting feeling that comes with it. Oddly, this wasn #8217;t a terribly bad c#t. I wasn #8217;t at any risk of bleeding out at all, and since it was stitched the infection chances are low. This was just me hitting the wrong place.

Exactly! It #8217;s just this total conflict of numb and sensitivity and when it #8217;s in a large area different areas are more sensitive or more numb but overall it just feels #8220;off #8221;. Obviously after dealing with it for 5 years your subconscious kinda forgets it, but when something touches it unexpectedly it #8217;s such a jolt of pain. I feel like the luckiest person alive that it affected the outside of my hand and fingers and not my palm and inside my fingers, honestly life would be so different and hard I cannot imagine coping with that.

It #8217;s hard because I know arms are one of the main targets for people. All I have to say is just 1 mistake and the harm goes from being just a scar that fades with time to permanent damage that won #8217;t go away

It #8217;s the stinging pins and needles I find the hardest, if it was just numb I #8217;d find it easier. I have random spots on both arms of nerve damage but it #8217;s generally just affecting a small area around the scar and often just completely numb, no pain at all. But I have a sensation on my hand that you get when part of your body falls asleep and it #8217;s just fuzzy and hurts, but instead of going away after the blood flow returns, it #8217;s been there 5 years and pressure on it amplifies the pain. It sucks so bad. Hopefully having numbness on your hip isn #8217;t really uncomfortable, please be careful though

I haven #8217;t done it for a year now, and last year I only did it a couple of times. Before that I #8217;d been 2 years or so without it. But after I did the hand nerve damage I was still doing it heaps around that time. I was just very unwell and didn #8217;t care enough that I could make it worse or do more

I #8217;ve been on a lot of different meds over the years and seen psych services regularly/weekly for a fair bit of that too (and still do). Honestly I #8217;m not really sure how I #8217;ve gotten better than I was. I think what helped was having a lot of reflection? Really analysing my past and accepting things for what they are, and I finally after 6 years had a goal in life other than to die

When we #8217;re unwell our mind really doesn #8217;t view the world right. There #8217;s no better way to put it. I know you feel they #8217;re not that bad or think you can barely see your scars, but you #8217;re still harming yourself. You #8217;re causing damage. You get in a cycle of hurting yourself and still not realising that it #8217;s bad. You might not view them as prominent now but later things could change and you #8217;ll realise that even though you say #8220;not that bad #8221; they were worse than your mind told you to believe.

I #8217;m actually trying to get off my medication, reducing them gradually in the hopes one day I won #8217;t need to down pills in the morning and night. I know some people find meds really help but I don #8217;t think it #8217;s always the answer. And I don #8217;t think meds alone can ever fix you completely. My goal is to try and do art, I want to be an artist, so I #8217;ve started studying again. I #8217;ve had a lot of therapy, different people different techniques. I love my current psychologist, I met him in 2015 and he #8217;s been a huge help. Finding the right psychologist makes a big difference. I met a lot of shit ones before him

WRITING.TITLE: It was suggested I crosspost this over here

WRITING.TEXT: You could pass it off as a surgery scar? Often surgery scars that are required on forearms are long and have been stitched back together in a similar fashion. If someone asks what happened you could say #8220;I just had a bad arm injury that needed to be repaired #8221; (technically not even a lie). And if they want more details you can just say #8220;It was awhile ago and I #8217;d rather not discuss it anymore #8221;
I guess so, I just feel bad that I was in there over something self inflicted rather than being genuinely hurt or sick

I do try and warn them, but I can be incredibly dissociated and not really present and words don #8217;t work if that makes sense. Sometimes I #8217;d hurt myself then blink and all of a sudden someone is stitching me and the entire middle can be so fuzzy or even completely blank. But when I am in the moment enough I do try and tell them it can be hard :/
Honestly I #8217;d wait a bit longer. It still has a slight purple tinge to it. Waiting for it to be lighter is safer

Thank you, it has been around a year since I was hurting myself where it was spraying (it did happen in the past before it but it mainly happened last year). I guess I still just struggle with guilt but I #8217;m hoping I come to terms with it Sorry edit because made a mistake

Thanks, it #8217;s hard because I really, really don #8217;t want to go back to hurting myself. It #8217;s just a dark pit that sucks you in. But even though I haven #8217;t done it for a year the thoughts and urges have been there every day it #8217;s just shitty. Having the thoughts all the time just mean my brain constantly re-lives the negative experiences I wish wouldn #8217;t (or even didn #8217;t) happen. I made this account mainly to vent, no way I #8217;m doing this to people I know lol.

WRITING.TITLE: Freaking out about scars and uni classes
WRITING.TEXT: Legit don #8217;t want to melt in this summer, it #8217;s spring and already getting warmer and warmer. But the thought of classmates and teachers seeing my harm gives me such panic. I dunno if I can do it. I posted a story in /selfharm but I #8217;m fucking freaking out about the fucking scars and legit just more scared than ever. I hate my scars with a passion. Fucking sick of having this constant reminder on my body. Yet still wanna bloody do it every day lmao even though I haven #8217;t done it for a year. Sometimes I just have the mindset #8220;my arms are already fucked anyway lol why does it matter if I just hurt them even more #8221; but after every relapse I #8217;ve had I just wish I fucking didn #8217;t. It #8217;s never as good as I remember. Every time I hurt myself after a break I #8217;m just like #8220;wtf why do I do this, this fucking sucks #8221; because I hate cleaning up blood and going to emergency and wound care and having to shift my whole life around waiting for healing to happen. I really think the negative outweighs the positive for me. Yet still something about it made it worth it and idek what the fuck that was. Wanna cry though thinking about classmates and teachers seeing my arms. You guys that have enough confidence to just go #8220;fuck you world I #8217;m sick of hiding #8221; are beyond brave. I #8217;m embarrassed and weak as piss doing it

4 years is a decent whack of time, yeah. Just have heard horror stories of people getting tattoos too quickly and the scar splits open. The longer you wait the less chance of it happening. Loss of colour is one of the key elements to that

WRITING.TEXT: The faces of despair some nurses and doctors give you when you need stitches can suck, but closing wounds is so important, can be very dangerous if you don #8217;t

There was one day I required 66 stitches in one hit and I just ended up talking to the guy about video games for hours while he worked away lol. It #8217;s hard with lots of wounds because the anaesthetic starts to wear off before they #8217;re done stitching but when he #8217;d poke somewhere and ask if I feel anything I just said no because I didn #8217;t want to take up anymore of his time

WRITING.TITLE: I only binge when I #8217;m stressed?
WRITING.TEXT: I started losing weight awhile ago and it was actually going incredibly successfully. I was mainly restricting, would liquid/water fast once/twice a week, and 1 day a week I allowed myself to eat a bit more than usual. Had a steady decline in weight, was feeling amazing. I felt like I was doing it ~safely~ but I don #8217;t think I was lol idk at the time my whole life revolved around food, calories, body checks and my scales. But then whenever anything becomes really stressful in my life, I just eat absolutely everything I can. I might just have a stressful day and eat so much, or if my stress levels are high enough it can last days or even weeks. I recently moved and started uni and I #8217;ve been eating like crazy. It feels like I only have willpower if my life isn #8217;t too stressful. Once I #8217;m stressed all self control goes out the window. As a result I #8217;ve gained back nearly 1/3 of what I lost since May/June, and feeling like shit about it. I was doing so well. I felt like I #8217;d be able to continue with my plan of eating and fasting but I #8217;m so stressed over uni and the only thing that helps is food. I hate myself for it.
I #8217;m so glad I could brighten up your day for a moment lt;3
I #8217;m honestly relieved others do this lol
Seems not! I wasn #8217;t sure either
And then you start thinking #8220;I can only see them so well because I know exactly where to look and normal people won #8217;t do that because they have no idea so reall- #8220;
I #8217;ll end up buying a heap of crap food thinking I #8217;ll be sensible and if I spread it out I won #8217;t need to heavily binge all the time but it never works and I keep doing it
You seem like a genius at the time, after you #8217;re well into your 2nd bag of chips telling yourself if they #8217;re all gone you can #8217;t eat them tomorrow
Yeah I wish I didn #8217;t feel so nervous, I wish I could feel comfortable. Some of my harm does look very sort of normal and I #8217;d easily remain anonymous but some are very unique I guess?
It me

I #8217;m sorry your binge eating is also linked to stress :/ Your year doesn #8217;t sound like it #8217;s been a great time. I was in heavy stress when the Aus bushfires hit but got it under control. Then the idea of uni came along and I was preparing and stuff to find a house and packing/moving. Covid hit and I struggled. Then actually being accepted into uni scared the crap out of me. And it was time to actually move. Now I #8217;m doing uni I #8217;m literally so fucking stressed all the time. Also doesn #8217;t help I started a contraceptive to stop my periods (they #8217;re fucked) and I had a period lasting 19 days and that was horrible and stressful and I just wanted to eat to stop thinking about it.

I #8217;m the opposite, I binge on savoury. Down bags of chips, way too many toasted cheese sandwiches (could eat like 6 in a day, 12 fucking pieces of bread), multiple bowls of just pasta and cheese, 2min noodle cups, a fuck ton of Uber eats where I #8217;d get burgers and chips, and savoury biscuits and dip. I just can #8217;t stop when I #8217;m stressed it #8217;s ridiculous.
Smort

Going to sound like the devil but hear me out. You should be scared. Your body doesn #8217;t want pain in an animal/biological sense. When you #8217;re unwell and can ignore/deflect that hardwired desire and instinct to be safe, it #8217;s very dangerous. Trust me, all it takes is the wrong move in the wrong place and you might have consequences that aren #8217;t just scars.
Maybe you need to remove any sharps from yourself? Seeing as though your mind doesn #8217;t want you to, if there are no sharps your body can #8217;t do it. Try and throw away everything?
Sucks big time :/

Could it be worth putting it somewhere else in the house when you #8217;ve finished using it for crafts? Somewhere in like a cupboard or box? Sometimes having it physically distanced (especially if you live with your parent/s and you want to harm at night) makes it harder to do it because you have to go a decent way to retrieve it. Such as in a drawer or cupboard in your lounge room or some other weird place somewhere far from your room?
The only time I don #8217;t eat all the crap in my house in a binge is if I decide to get way too much food from Uber eats instead lmao

Tattoos have a different sort of feeling than self harm imo. If it #8217;s just a small semi-colon it #8217;ll be done super quick (maybe like 15min or so) it won #8217;t hurt much at all. It kinda feels like firm scratching with your nail onto skin. Idk but I think a lot of people overreact? One of my tattooists said #8220;if it really hurt too much then no one would ever come back to get a second one #8221; which basically sums it up. The pain is more severe the longer a tattoo is being done like it builds up, and for me it felt more like scratching at sunburn when the lady had to go onto my scar tissue over and over and over to get the ink to really sink in Edit- actually it #8217;ll probably be less than 15min. And pretty much once it #8217;s done it doesn #8217;t hurt anymore. Unless it #8217;s a big one then it feels like sunburn and takes awhile to heal
Damn that #8217;d make me so stressed

I #8217;ve had times they didn #8217;t bother with anaesthetic, especially when they want me out ASAP and just staple me and say goodbye. I remember times where even though they were holding the skin together the staple wouldn #8217;t catch the other end and it #8217;d claw into the wound and the doctor would look at me real quick but I wouldn #8217;t even flinch so he #8217;d just pull it out and try again. I #8217;ve had a similar problem where they under-stitched wounds, definitely needed more than they gave me. It #8217;s like what #8217;s the point of me coming in if you #8217;re not even going to close it right. After I #8217;d harm I generally don #8217;t hurt anymore for ages, not enough for the pricks of needles to do anything other than a slight discomfort. I #8217;d never really move and just wanted to let them finish so they could help others.
Lol for me sometimes they wouldn #8217;t even ask and I never brought it up

WRITING.TITLE: I feel like this is too serious for just the selfharm reddit but I wanted to talk about this and it #8217;s got very heavy suicide TW
WRITING.TEXT: Basically, I found out that someone successfully killed themselves in a ward I used to be in. I found out through someone I know that works there. I was honestly so surprised someone managed to pull it off. When she told me I was already so curious as to how they did it because that ward was incredibly well built to be safe, nurses do their rounds often, and you get checked if you go out on leave (if you #8217;re allowed leave) to make sure you haven #8217;t brought anything back. My first thought was that they smuggled in something sharp and bled to death. I know people have tried hanging themselves with their bedding (or clothes) by ripping them up but there #8217;s no real hanging points so it doesn #8217;t work. I thought maybe they brought drugs in and ODd. But it wasn #8217;t any of these. *He managed to split his head open by essentially throwing himself onto part of the bed frame, more than once, with the impact on his head.* I was literally shocked. I never would have expected that to work. He must have been so fucking determined. He got found on one of the nurse rounds who obviously fucking freaked out as the floor was covered in blood and there was a massive event filled with fear. He got rushed to intensive care since he was still alive, but they couldn #8217;t help him, he lost too much blood and died. Originally they thought maybe he had a seizure and fell and hit his head. But the death was investigated and determined to be a suicide after they realised he would have needed to land on his head more than once to do it, and the force required would #8217;ve been immense and a simple fall wouldn #8217;t have sufficed. I was just like damn. Middle aged man split his head open by throwing himself at the bed frame. Fucking wild.

Omg I legit just fucking finished eating my Uber eats lmao I have no self control. It #8217;s like OKAY I #8217;m NOT going to eat from the cupboard. *spongebob narrator voice: 10 seconds later* aight I #8217;ll order me some Uber eats :) Fml

I should delete that fucking app but the minute I want to order something it #8217;d be back on my phone anyway. What #8217;s worse is when I #8217;m still wanting to binge and I order Uber eats twice in the same day like a fucking whale :(

I just started uni in July, I #8217;ve been so fucking stress and basically instead of harming I #8217;ve been binge eating lol. Atm it #8217;s all online though so I still dunno what I #8217;m going to do when it goes back to in person. Seriously freaking out. Part of me I think wants to go fuck it and post another part of my arm. I only really have 1 friend that would be like umm wtf because she also used to harm but she #8217;d make me feel shit for posting it online When I lived in a youth residence place I #8217;d cut in the bathtub too. No water on, just made it so much quicker to clean. Before that I just cut in my bedroom but they weren #8217;t severe and I could manage them. My most recent ones from last year I sat on the shower floor, also no water. But I #8217;d hit arteries and it #8217;d fucking spray the walls and shit. My most frustrating part was wound care. After I #8217;d get stitched, it would just take soo long. I was spending hundreds on first aid supplies. Changing covers and bandages sucks so much.

I #8217;m mainly worried about 1 friend finding it. I know she uses reddit. She used to self harm too around the time I was. She would be very like disappointed and just go wtf if she found stuff here

Yeah I #8217;ve been in treatment a heap. One small outpatient place I #8217;ve been to like 8 times, maybe more, had to leave multiple times for harming. Then I was in an out of one ward bouncing between that and the first outpatient, went to the youth residence place, got kicked out for harming, and then stuck in that ward for 14months. Then we moved across to a new ward and I was there for nearly a year. Went to this seperate treatment place, was there for like a month, back in the ward. There for a long time. Transferred to a new ward for a long time. Finally got out. All in all, the last 5 years probably 3.5 have been spent in wards. Fucking sucks. My last stay was late last year. Somehow I #8217;ve never passed out, I #8217;ve come very close multiple times, but never passed out. In the youth residence the 3rd time they called the ambulance on me (which was also what got me kicked out) the paramedics were shocked I was still conscious. Lost around 2L of blood, generally that makes anyone pass out, often 1.5L makes people close to passing out. I #8217;d lost a lot of blood in previous ones too, making me incredibly dizzy and I can #8217;t hold myself up. My last ambo trip they had to wheelchair me out of the house, just so pale and weak, again they were surprised I hadn #8217;t fainted. Idk my body just deals with it I guess? But I definitely have had all the symptoms you listed, nausea, feeling hot, change in vision, I also have had some paralysing shock reactions. For whatever reason doesn #8217;t matter how fast the blood has gushed or sprayed out of me, I don #8217;t pass out. I think though the nightmare-ish experience you had after passing out could just be this overwhelming fear you had in the moments before you passed out, basically continuing? I definitely know the moment your body goes #8220;oh fuck oh fuck oh fuck oh fuck #8221; and your mind races

WRITING.TITLE: When you #8217;re actually having an alright time but your brain reminds you that you #8217;re a self destructive machine and ruins your fleeting happiness

I moved out for this exact reason thinking it #8217;d be the best thing I #8217;d ever do. It didn #8217;t end well at all. So I moved out, harmed very *very* badly multiple times, and then still just wanted to kill myself anyway, if not more than originally. Ended up staying in some outpatient clinic a few times, having a brief ward admission, then I just got fucking sick of dealing with healing wounds and stitches and nurses and psych teams it was just becoming so frustrating. I just wanted everything to stop. Not entirely sure what exactly got my mind to change but I #8217;ve been clean a year now. I still want to harm, have thoughts and urges present every second of the day, regardless of what I #8217;m doing or how well the day is going or if I #8217;m in a class or whatever. I #8217;m just not following through with it because it just leads to disaster and every time I thought it was the answer I #8217;d come out of it feeling worse than when I went in. I still think I #8217;ll relapse because it feels inevitable, but I know trying to resist the temptation is helping me actually have a life other than hurting myself.

WRITING.TITLE: Me trying to keep my year clean streak going while my mind is telling me on repeat that relapsing isn #8217;t even that bad

WRITING.TEXT: I guess the thing is, if you #8217;ve cut her off and sent her all your money, she #8217;s already probably quite worried and doesn #8217;t know what to do. I #8217;m unsure what sort of friendship you have (in terms of how close, trust and honest etc), but could she be very concerned and want to tell someone but doesn #8217;t want to get you in trouble and hurt your feelings/break trust by exposing you? If you did kill yourself now and she hasn #8217;t told anyone about this, I am certain she #8217;d be left with incredible guilt for not speaking up. I think you should reach out. If you tell her though that you intend to move out to harm (even if you think it #8217;ll stop you from killing yourself) and you want some money back, that #8217;s also going to be a difficult decision for her to make. But I don #8217;t think you should lie about this. Lying in this situation will just linger in the back of your mind and make you feel like shit. I #8217;m unsure where you live and why there #8217;s such a long waitlist. Here we have dozens of public and private clinics and some psychs you can get into very quickly. We also have free services that you can go to that also have help lines that you can call and they let you know where your closest one is located and any other suggestions about finding help. Is there a chance you could travel a bit further to get to a psych sooner? Even if it #8217;s out of town and you have to drive awhile to get there, if it can be sooner it #8217;ll be worth it. The other option is just fessing up to your parents and going to the emergency department and telling them you need immediate help. That you #8217;re actively suicidal. Emergencies here have a psych triage team that do 1 on 1 chats with you, sometimes for an hour. If they don #8217;t think you #8217;re safe to go home then you #8217;ll get help. They #8217;ll ask you to stay overnight and re-evaluate in the morning, or might just send you to a ward for a bit. They want you to be safe. Most places won #8217;t lock you in a ward for huge stays to begin with. The thing is with uni, you #8217;ve gotta consider is it worth struggling but forcing yourself to keep doing uni and feeling like you want to harm and die 24/7, or getting the mental help you actually need so that you aren #8217;t in this constant battle and can try and recover rather than just being consumed by it. In the long run, being mentally okay comes above uni. You can always go back to uni or education. You can #8217;t undo a suicide. You can #8217;t undo permanent nerve damage or arm weakness and pain (which I #8217;m now stuck with forever). You can #8217;t let uni prevent you from getting help, because if you don #8217;t get help chances are you won #8217;t be able to continue with uni anyway. You might have to drop out if your mental health keeps declining. Edit- Also the hospital would take you explaining about not wanting to fuck up uni being a #8220;preventative measure #8221; regarding your safety. It doesn #8217;t matter if you go in bawling your eyes out and shouting or being calm, if you still want to function for uni you #8217;ll be deemed mentally okay enough to go home.

I don #8217;t think she #8217;d agree you #8217;re a bad person therefore you should cut her out of your life. If you #8217;re really close this will be upsetting both for her and you. She obviously cares about you and you care about her. Don #8217;t kick supports and friends out of your life. I #8217;m 100% agreeing to kicking toxic friends out but she doesn #8217;t sound like one. I really think she #8217;d be in shock having all your money in her account. Could your parents drive you further out? Do you have any relatives that would? It does seem a bit backwards to just make every service free therefore there will always be a massive backlog. Obviously charging people $170 a session isn #8217;t ideal but if you #8217;re on a wait list for months I #8217;d rather pay to get sessions. With suicide, people reach a point where nothing matters, they don #8217;t care anymore about commitments and just want everything to end. They #8217;ll drop out of school, quit their job, isolate, might abuse harming, alcohol and drugs etc. They no longer see a future. I know it #8217;s not always like this though. If you #8217;re still wanting to go to uni and not cause family tension, then that #8217;s currently stopping you from suicide. Or at least, medical professionals see it that way. They often judge a persons suicidality on these traits. I #8217;m not saying you #8217;re not actively suicidal, but you #8217;re still at a point where you have things in your life you care about. Uni and avoiding family tension. While family tension sucks, it #8217;s better to cause tension by getting hospitalised if it means you #8217;ll be safe and get help. If you still want uni to happen, you even have a goal for yourself you want to complete. I seriously think you should just come clean and cause family tension. It #8217;s the better outcome. They just have to deal with it. You need to put yourself first. I would reach out to your friend. But I still don #8217;t advise moving out just to harm. It won #8217;t end well. It absolutely will not. You #8217;ll think getting to harm whenever you want will solve your suicidal thoughts. It won #8217;t.

WRITING.TITLE: Reducing lamotrigine via cutting the tablet
WRITING.TEXT: I take 200mg APO-Lamotrigine morning and night. The tablet is dissolvable so it #8217;s just this big, flat oval and just disintegrates super quickly in liquid. I know it #8217;s very bad to go cold turkey with this medication and it took 8 months to reach the dose I #8217;m on (this was done approx 3 years ago). I would be incredibly cautious and drop a fraction for maybe 3 weeks, then drop it again for 3 weeks etc, possibly alternating between dropping the morning then the night. Because of the size and shape of the tablet, it is very easy to cut it into pieces just with a knife so it would definitely be doable to start taking away fractions. But I #8217;d just need to know if the actual medication is spread evenly within the dissolvable tablet. Thanks.

Helplines have a #8220;duty of care #8221;. If they deem you unsafe and an immediate risk, they are required by law to do something about it. Don #8217;t take it personally on whoever #8217;s on the phone, they are abiding the law and their job. They would get in serious trouble if they did nothing about it. When you call helplines you #8217;re being evaluated, they have to assess the danger you #8217;re in. It #8217;s not just about having someone to talk to, they are very glad you #8217;re reaching out and having the talk, but they also have a job to follow. I sort of want to give you a timeline of what I think will happen if you move out in your current state of mind, in terms of what exactly happened to me. And this is just a serious concern. I want you to really think about this. You #8217;ll move out. You #8217;ll feel amazing. You have freedom and privacy. A sense of relief will wash over you. You #8217;ll start harming, it will feel great. Knowing you have no limits will bring you joy. You #8217;ll harm more and more. But then what happens? You realise harming isn #8217;t actually stopping your suicidal thoughts and your internal battles. It doesn #8217;t matter how much you harm, how deep you go, how often you do it. You will NEVER be satisfied. I mean that 100%. It wouldn #8217;t matter if you could harm 10 times a day because you have the freedom to do so. You will NEVER just make those suicidal thoughts vanish when you were ADAMANT self harm was the answer. You #8217;ll spiral down even further. You #8217;ll get hit in the face that harming will NEVER work like you thought it would. You #8217;ll breakdown and feel like total shit. Your suicidal thoughts will be worse than ever. You #8217;ll just want to scream and cry, you #8217;ll feel utterly helpless. There #8217;s also the risk with harming that you #8217;ll disable yourself because you have no limits now. You #8217;ll do serious and permanent nerve damage. I was lucky years ago. I almost fucked my entire hand. I #8217;ve being hitting muscles and tendons, and my arms can be so weak and ache because scar tissue is attached to them. If you harm and hit the wrong thing? You might lose all control of your hand. It might be damaged, and you won #8217;t be able to use your fingers. The whole thing could be numb and constant pins and needles. But harming is what you wanted, right? Trust me you #8217;ll be going down a dark path. A very dark path. You need serious and immediate help so this does not get out of control. It will ruin your life if you don #8217;t get the help you need. It #8217;ll be tough but you need to tell your parents and go to hospital. Show them you #8217;re still harming. Tell the staff at emergency how close you are to killing yourself and show them your scars.

Idk but like I wish I could harm there because atm I hate it more than any part of my body and I wish I could destroy it lol

I often find myself giving warnings now. For shots or blood tests especially. In the past when I haven #8217;t told them they can be startled and I don #8217;t like making them uncomfortable. It #8217;s super awkward to do, I basically just say #8220;I will warn you, I have some significant self harm scarring... #8221; like it #8217;s embarrassing to do it but reaction wise I think it #8217;s easier on the other person. Then I take off my hoodie and hope they #8217;re not too worried about me (but sometimes they are and ask questions)
I #8217;m pretty sure it #8217;s a can of drink lol but you actually can drink most soups straight from a can! They only have heating suggestions because people generally prefer it to be hot :)

Some of my harm has been pretty intense, I #8217;d cause a lot of damage on my chest I think if I really wanted to, especially because they #8217;re full of fat. I #8217;d just breakdown completely if they turned me away because I had self harmed there though. And thanks, it really isn #8217;t great hating your body or yourself as a person and going as far as hurting it. Hopefully you start feeling better in yourself. And I #8217;m really hoping once my chest has gone I #8217;ll have a big shift in my mindset because the dysphoria will be gone :)

When I haven #8217;t had the energy to heat up canned soup I #8217;ve just poured it into a big mug and started drinking and spooning it cold. It sounds gross tbh but yeah. I #8217;m vegan though and there #8217;d probably be some meat ones that require heating lol
Yeah having them go speechless and silent for the rest of the appointment feels so tense and horrible. You can tell they just want you in and out now asap

I thankfully don #8217;t need to go to them all that often, or when I do chances are I can wear a hoodie. I had to go to emergency for period related problems and they did a blood test and I was in so much pain that I forgot to mention the scars and it got awkward real quick

WRITING.TITLE: Feeling like an idiot
WRITING.TEXT: My life has been going so well, better than it #8217;s been in like 9 years, but I still just want to harm so bad? I #8217;m in my early/mid 20s, and I was #8220;late #8221; to start harming, I didn #8217;t do it as a minor. I always felt guilty I started so late as if I was acting like a child anyway. I haven #8217;t done it for a bit over a year now. I #8217;ve gone into uni, never thought I #8217;d be alive this long let alone returning to education. Atm it #8217;s all online so I haven #8217;t had to deal with people seeing my scars. I feel shit because next year will probably be going back to in person gradually. I hate that I feel like I need to hide from embarrassment and not wanting to concern anyone. So I hate myself even more for still wanting to harm knowing it #8217;s just going to cause more problems. I guess I just wanted to rant. How can I still be self destructive when I #8217;m doing something I never thought I #8217;d ever be alive or in the mental capacity to do? My thoughts drive me crazy.
I #8217;m an idiot at it #8217;s finest lol
Wish it #8217;d take my boobs to help my gender dysphoria lmao I will gladly swap if anyone wants em #128536;
Indeed, enby as fuck

WRITING.TITLE: The #8220;it won #8217;t happen to me #8221; mentality around self harm is beyond dangerous
WRITING.TEXT: You hear this all the time. #8220;I won #8217;t crash if I drive when I #8217;ve had a few drinks. I won #8217;t get lung cancer from smoking. I won #8217;t fall off a building trying to do parkour. I won #8217;t still have an eating disorder once I reach my UGW. I won #8217;t gamble all my money away. I won #8217;t take street drugs and become an addict. #8221; Etc etc. We have this mentality of disconnecting ourselves from negative outcomes because...it won #8217;t happen to me? Wrong. I never thought my self harm would go as far as it did. I never believed I #8217;d cause permanent nerve damage. I never thought I #8217;d have to deal with severe scars. I never believed I #8217;d have to go to emergency to get fixed. I never thought I #8217;d cause weakness in my arms. I never thought it would become my only coping method. I never thought it #8217;d make me anaemic. I never believed stopping would be this hard. I never thought I #8217;d be admitted to a psych ward because of harming. I was adamant it wasn #8217;t as bad as people were telling me. I fucking thought none of that would ever happen to me. Ever. But harming is so fucking risky. It #8217;s a slippery slope. You go from just doing it a little bit to doing it a lot. You go from doing it every now and then to doing it all the time. You go from just breaking the epidermis to reaching the dermis to reaching the hypodermis to reaching muscles and tendons. You cause nerve damage that cannot be repaired. You believe harming will only help, nothing bad will happen. You think you can stop and move on with your life once you #8217;re feeling better. All of a sudden everything you thought would never happen to you will happen. I really beg you be so fucking careful. This isn #8217;t a game, this isn #8217;t fun, this isn #8217;t helping. Get proper help before your whole life revolves around hurting yourself. Don #8217;t let yourself live like this. This is not okay.

It kind of scares me there #8217;s people that start when they #8217;re like 10. Especially since it #8217;s often something that gets worse over time. Some might fade in colour a touch which will be great but it #8217;s more the texture and the really large ones that are problematic. I #8217;ve got multiple scars that run almost the full length of my forearms sort of on the underside (it #8217;s hard to explain but it #8217;s like from the bottom of your elbow up towards your wrist?) but yeah they are so glaringly obvious it just sucks. They #8217;re taking so long to lose their colour too
Having raised scars is more to do with your genetics and biology. You simply might never get raised scars no matter what you do
Or my fat rolls lmao
I #8217;m sorry you #8217;ve had this happen as well

There is no #8220;properly #8221;, harm is harm. Severity doesn #8217;t matter regarding if you scarred or not. All that changes is how much it will fuck up the rest of your life as everything slowly escalates and all of a sudden you #8217;re out of control

I don #8217;t think people realise how easily nerve damage can happen, and how horrible the consequences are. I found that out the hard way, I had minor nerve damage that just affected the spots where the scars were and it was really odd to touch it and feel nothing or feel pins and needles but I shrugged it off. Then 1 cut caused permanent nerve damage to half my hand. Knowing that will never come back is horrible. Exactly. If it never happened then no one would ever get lung cancer from smoking. But it does happen and it can happen to anyone that smokes but we deny the risk actually happen to us. I #8217;m sorry you #8217;re still struggling with it all, it isn #8217;t nice and 100% a drug. I #8217;m a year harm free which I never thought would ever happen

I tried them when I was maybe 15/16. I never found them comfortable to wear and everyone just said I hadn #8217;t put them in right and it #8217;s harder when you #8217;re a virgin. So I gave up on them. When I was 20 I tried again. This time they didn #8217;t make me uncomfortable having them in. It #8217;s not the nicest thing to do pushing something up your vagina if you #8217;ve never done it before. But the benefits for me was having twice the protection for heavy periods. Tampon + pad helped immensely for leaking and not needing to change my pad every hour. I also find having the blood dealt with inside my vagina rather than spread all over a pad in my undies much better as it made me feel more clean? If you #8217;re nervous to try, look at some tutorials on how they #8217;re inserted. A huge part is what position your body is in to make the tampon slide in nice and easy rather than having to push it into a tight space. The main thing I #8217;d suggest is to buy the smallest ones you can first. Have a good feel of your vagina (easy to do in the shower), making sure you #8217;re aware of what #8217;s going on down there. I didn #8217;t like the thought of it at first but tampons made my life much easier.
It really is so important. Especially nerve damage since it #8217;s permanent. One wrong move and you can do much more damage than anticipated

I #8217;m sorry you #8217;re also in such a struggle atm :( Having aches sucks, my arms are so weak I #8217;m so shit at lifting heavy things. Most of mine were stitched or stapled so it did greatly help the healing process. But my arms are covered in scars now and I won #8217;t be able to get rid of them

I think the problem is often the #8220;good enough #8221; people seek can get higher and higher, so while you #8217;ve found your happy spot of scarring to a standard it sounds like it #8217;s no longer escalating, not everyone find that point where they #8217;re satisfied. I #8217;m glad you #8217;re at a spot now where you #8217;re 30 and managing it all. The problem is it #8217;s not always the case people are so lucky and not have it take over. A big problem is also there are people so young on here, and a lot of them mightn #8217;t realise how addicting this will become and how dangerous it can get. Another problem is people can also be in a really bad mental space and harming is their main way to cope, such as having severe depression and anxiety (especially if they #8217;re still at school). If you #8217;re working and managing a business it seems you #8217;re at a place now where you are very much in control of your life as a whole. Kids on here aren #8217;t yet.

I #8217;ve also been in and out of psych wards many many times with some stays lasting over and year and I #8217;d see people come in, leave and come back later and go #8220;you #8217;re still here?? #8221; It was shit. Honestly though the problem is when someone #8217;s desperate almost anything can be a tool to harm. I #8217;ve also got scars from things that sound ridiculous from when I was in the ward that they #8217;d then take off me. At one point I turned to hair pulling until I had a bald spot because they can #8217;t really stop you doing it and they know I won #8217;t cause serious harm and yeah it was fucked. It can be hard to relate to people when they haven #8217;t been through what you #8217;ve been through

My recommendation would be to get a tattoo :) not only will it cover them if you ever go to a workplace that get weird about them, but it also is so nice to look at your arm and see art there instead of scars. Getting a tattoo over some of my old scars was an amazing feeling

The problem is though that your suggestion could be more dangerous. Especially because they #8217;ll go out and buy it brand new and what they #8217;ve been using could have been dull, it #8217;ll be very dangerous. Plus I would feel a level of guilt knowing I gave suggestions on what you should hurt yourself with. If I told someone and they attempted using what I suggested I would feel horrible

WRITING.TITLE: Staples instead of stitches?
WRITING.TEXT: I know some of you need to go to emergency for stitches but has anyone else ever had staples? I had them years ago and they left big dot scars (some of my stitches have too but basically every staple one stayed while stitch ones 80% of the time faded away after months to years). They were pretty shit because you had to go and get them removed with this tool by a doctor or nurse. Sometimes the harsh movement of them removing the staple would partially reopen the wound so it seemed stupid. When I was in the ward sometimes I #8217;d pull them out myself and the nurses would be so pissed and shocked and couldn #8217;t understand how it didn #8217;t hurt. Getting them inserted was also weird, they held the skin together and just use this stapling thing to clunk them together. A few times one edge of the staple wouldn #8217;t have grabbed the other side of the skin so it would staple into the wound instead (what I mean by that is scraping into the inside of the wound as only one side of the skin caught it) and it would start bleeding again. I felt like the hospital just wanted to get me out ASAP because many times they didn #8217;t bother using anaesthetic and just grabbed the stapler. It was much quicker than stitching. Has anyone else had them too?

Yeah, I guess my main point with the dull and sharp thing was just if they #8217;ve been using something dull and applying firm pressure, when they move to something sharp and apply that same pressure it could do a lot more damage than expected. I #8217;ve experienced this first hand many times
It made me feel like Frankenstein a bit but yeah I think your stitches are getting taken out too early if they #8217;re reopening

I #8217;m sorry you did enough damage to your legs in one hit to require 200 staples, that must #8217;ve been a really shit time for you and I hope you #8217;re doing better. It #8217;s really good to hear they healed so well though. Do you have the dots next to the scars or did they go away? God yes I remember how itchy they would be, compared to stitches they were so much itchier for sure. I often get/got bruising from stitches and staples so I #8217;d look fucking weird with gross yellow skin and purple and metal clamping wounds shut

I #8217;d often get student doctors for some of my minor ones that needed stitches. It #8217;s great practice for them to stitch sh wounds because they #8217;re generally a very clean wound (like in terms of it often being a straight line incision but also clean hygiene wise) and it #8217;s just about shutting it. When compared to like an accident based wound where the skin might be a bit messed up torn on the edges etc and harder to align again. One thing I wasn #8217;t too happy about was when I needed internal stitches as well as external and the doctor was showing the med student the technique and once he finished the internal ones he did like 3 external ones and asked if she felt she could do the rest. She didn #8217;t do the best job but because it was internally stitched it didn #8217;t hugely make a difference compared to if it wasn #8217;t. Then it would #8217;ve been really really shit. Internal stitches have made the biggest difference to reduce my scarring from certain wounds
In Australia we don #8217;t have the second problem. But for me it #8217;s replaced with #8220;won #8217;t be allowed out of a psych ward again for a very long time #8221;

Honestly they are going to be really kind about it. I #8217;ve got 3 tattoos so far, one was next to scars and one was right on top of scars. The one next to the guy didn #8217;t even say a word, we just chatted about random topics for the 1.5 hours. For the one over scars all the lady said was #8220;just letting you know scar tissue can hold ink differently and I might need to go over parts a couple of times which might hurt more than usual #8221;. They didn #8217;t say anything else, didn #8217;t ask if I was mentally okay, didn #8217;t ask if I #8217;m getting help, didn #8217;t ask for my history or bring it up etc. They #8217;re artists and they love what they do, they #8217;ll happily just work away :)

It will really depend on your design and which scars exactly you #8217;re going over. With my heavily scarred arm I got a tattoo over, the lady had to rework a section an extra 4 times I believe just to really embed the ink. Because scar tissue is different to skin tissue there are 3 possibilities; it will take more ink to fill the scar tissue, the ink will bleed/blur once it hits the scar tissue so some designs might look a bit off, the scar tissue will behave pretty closely to skin. I think the biggest key with designs over scars is choosing ones that will fit the scar. Ones that won #8217;t distort because the skin isn #8217;t flat

In that case what I #8217;d suggest is to start on smaller ones first, and ones that are even with the skin (not indented or raised). See how your scar tissue behaves. Wait a month for the tattoo to be fully healed and see how it looks. If it went well, work your way through your other scars, maybe have a design plan to make a larger tattoo piece that covers the majority of your leg/arm in a joined design as it will blend out the scars into the skin. A good tattoo artist will be able to make it work for sure though, and don #8217;t be afraid to swap to another one. Make sure though that your scars are completely white. With larger wounds it #8217;s very important it #8217;s been 3+ years, there #8217;s horror stories of people getting tattoos too quickly and the scar splits open. For smaller wounds you don #8217;t need to wait that long (some people still get tattoos on pink scars if they haven #8217;t gone past the dermis), but for your scars you #8217;ll need to be careful. Let me know if you have more questions though because I #8217;m happy to answer! Covering scars with a tattoo was one of the best decisions I #8217;ve ever made and helped so much. Eventually I want every single one covered :)

If you can #8217;t stop the bleeding yourself after firm pressure for ~10min, you should to tell another person so that they can help you. They #8217;ll have to make sure the bleeding does stop with their help otherwise you #8217;ll need to go to the hospital. If you cut to the fat layer you need stitches within 12 hours, so you #8217;ll also need to go to hospital. If things are dire, such as cutting into a larger vein or an artery (trust me you will know, blood will flood or spurt out) then you need help ASAP and should call an ambulance.
Please be careful harming your private parts. It isn #8217;t the cleanest environment and there #8217;s a higher chance for bacteria to enter any wounds

The biggest thing is to relax as much as possible, when you #8217;re anxious you tense up and it will make the experience more painful. Take deep breaths and let the doctor know it #8217;s your first time and they can take it slower and reassure you.
I was just mad I didn #8217;t die and instead got revived, as I was losing consciousness I was finally peaceful
